metadata.title: CVE-2019-13032 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in FlightCrew v0.9.2 and earlier. A NULL pointerdereference occurs in GetRelativePathToNcx() orGetRelativePathsToXhtmlDocuments() when a NULL pointer is passed toxc::XMLUri::isValidURI(). This affects third-party software (not Sigil)that uses FlightCrew as a library.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

flightcrew - 0.7.2+dfsg-6ubuntu0.1
libflightcrew0v5 - 0.7.2+dfsg-6ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: flightcrew package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.7.2+dfsg-6ubuntu0.1').
